metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0850 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in linux kernel, where an information leak occurs via ext4_extent_header to userspace. It was discovered that the ext4 file system implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize memory in some situations. A privileged local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
